Retrieve a cohort from ATLAS for use in AllofUs

Source: R/aou_atlas_cohort.R
aou_atlas_cohort.Rd

This function retrieves a cohort definition from ATLAS and generates the cohort in All of Us. Observation periods are first generated for each subject using the aou_observation_period() function. The resulting cohort is a dataframe with the cohort start and end dates for each subject. The function is based on a similar function in https://github.com/cmayer2/r4aou with some tweaks to generate the appropriate observation periods and incorporate other package functions.

Usage

aou_atlas_cohort(
  cohort_id,
  base_url = "http://atlas-demo.ohdsi.org/WebAPI",
  persistence_window = 548,
  end_date_buffer = 60,
  exclude_aou_visits = FALSE
)

Arguments

cohort_id

The ID of the cohort to retrieve from ATLAS.

base_url

The URL of the ATLAS instance to use, ending in "/WebAPI". Defaults to the demo ATLAS at https://atlas-demo.ohdsi.org

persistence_window

Longest allowable time between visits for the same observation period. Defaults to 548 (see details)

end_date_buffer

Number of days to add to last observed date. Defaults to 60 (see details)

exclude_aou_visits

Whether to exclude All of Us clinical visits (i.e., for program-specific measurements, not part of the participants' typical EHR) from the observation period. Defaults to FALSE

Value

A dataframe with the resulting cohort. The SQL query used to generate the cohort is stored as an attribute.

Details

Follows conventions described here: https://ohdsi.github.io/CommonDataModel/ehrObsPeriods.html

Examples

if (FALSE) { # on_workbench()

# generate a simple stroke cohort
# see https://atlas-demo.ohdsi.org/#/cohortdefinition/1788061
cohort <- aou_atlas_cohort(1788061, base_url = "https://atlas-demo.ohdsi.org/WebAPI")

# print query that was executed
cat(attr(cohort, "query"))

}
